column1: AAAI Technical Track: Game Theory and Economic Paradigms
In the SHIFT-BRIBERY problem we are given an election
column3: and the costs of shifting this preferred candidate up the voters’ preference orders. The goal is to find such a set of shifts that ensures that the preferred candidate wins the election. We give the first polynomial-time approximation scheme for the case of positional scoring rules
column4: and for the Copeland rule we show strong inapproximability results.
